Trump’s @CFPBDirector Kathy Kraninger gutted the fair lending office and stopped filing lawsuits when companies cheat consumers. Now that the Supreme Court has reaffirmed the @CFPB's existence, Kraninger should stop working for the crooks and start working for working families.

The @CFPB's job is to get the tricks & traps out of credit cards, mortgages, student loans, & other financial products & hold big banks accountable when they cheat people. Under @RichCordray’s leadership, the agency returned $12B to consumers scammed by financial institutions.

Even after today’s ruling, the @CFPB is still an independent agency. The director of that agency still works for the American people. Not Donald Trump. Not Congress. Not the banking industry. Nothing in the Supreme Court ruling changes that.

Now, the Supreme Court should not have ignored the intent of Congress and allowed the President to remove the @CFPB director without cause. They just handed over more power to Wall Street's army of lawyers and lobbyists to push out a director who fights for the American people.

Let’s not lose sight of the bigger picture: after years of industry attacks and GOP opposition, a conservative Supreme Court recognized what we all knew: the @CFPB itself and the law that created it is constitutional. The CFPB is here to stay.

Decades after Roe v. Wade, abortion access is still under attack. While there's hope to be found in today's ruling, access to basic health services is still out of reach for millions of women. 9. The younger people driving the spike end up infecting people over 65 who represent close to 80% of the deaths

10. Therefore in both govt & in our personal lives,we should be laser focused on preventing this surge from crossing over to those 65+ old &/or at higher risk 5/5

7. The median age of the current case spike is 35,an age group that is 45% of our population but less than 1% of deaths to date

8.Therefore this spike should not IN & OF ITSELF,result in a subsequent death rate spike,UNLESS....(Cont)4/5

5. There is a 3 to 4 week lag time between infections & death

6. The numbers provide us both insight into what would lead to a death rate surge & guidance on what we should be doing RIGHT NOW to prevent that from happening.(cont)3/5

3. The real issue isn’t the big spike in cases,it’s whether the spike is higher than we expected & whether this subsequently results in a big spike in the death rate

4. So far the growth rate of new cases is up 17% but the daily death rate is down over 60%,BUT.....(cont)2/5
